p: Help advance the analytics capabilities of our organization thru engineering the data lake, data warehouse, and data marts and integrating that data into dashboard products
p.2: You will collaborate with peers on multiple analytics projects and help use data to drive operational efficiency, identify unique insights, and help answer critical questions
p.4: As a self-motivated team member, you will work with the data team and leaders to understand and develop analytical approaches to support our mission. Activities include:

li.2: integration of data into pipelines and ETL processes
li.4: troubleshooting data integrity and analysis issues

text.1: will continually search for opportunities to streamline processes and understand the needs of stakeholders, both internal and external

p.9: =E2=97=8F Be an enthusiastic, customer-centric, mission-oriented advocate for the organization
p.10: =E2=97=8F Spread the importance of using data and technology to develop ideas and answers to questions around the organization's mission
p.11: =E2=97=8F Able to work independently, in agile workflow w/ changing requirements & asynchronous communication
p.12: =E2=97=8F Perform business analysis to understand needs of teammates and stakeholders
p.13: =E2=97=8FReformulate and prioritize needs for the availability of data, technology, and priorities
p.14: =E2=97=8FCommunicate w/ team & stakeholders to provide updates and adjustments to achieving milestones and making delivery times
p.15: =E2=97=8F Perform data extraction, transformation, and loading, from operational systems and from third-party data sources, into other operational systems, analytical data lakes, and analytical data warehouses
p.16: =E2=97=8F Develop ad hoc analytics, written narratives, data summaries, data documentation, interactive Rmarkdown documents, and RShiny applications to deliver insights from data at scale
p.17: =E2=97=8F Develop statistical models and machine learning components where needed under the guidance of more senior data scientists

strong: Proficiency with some flavor of SQL, intermediate-level proficiency with the use of R and Python, and some exposure to basic web development languages such as HTML & CSS
